Package mines

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mines.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The Board class extends JPanel and represents the game board in Minesweeper. It contains an array of cells, and manages the game logic. This class initializes the game board, including setting up the cells and placing mines. It also handles user input and updates the game state accordingly.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • random

        private final java.util.Random random
        A pseudo-random number generator used to randomly place mines on the board. The Random instance is initialized in the constructor with the current time as the seed, so the sequence of numbers generated is likely to be different each time the program is run.

      • boardCells

        private transient java.util.List<Cell> boardCells
        A list that contains all the cells of the game board. The cells are stored in row-major order, i.e., each row is stored consecutively in the list. it is marked as transient to exclude it from serialization.

      • NUM_IMAGES

        private static final int NUM_IMAGES
        The total number of images.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • img

        private final transient java.awt.Image[] img
        An array of images used to represent the different cell states. The images are loaded once and stored in this array for easy access. The array is marked as final to ensure that its reference cannot be changed, and it is marked as transient to exclude it from serialization.

      • inGame

        private boolean inGame
        A boolean flag indicating whether the game is currently in progress or not. If the value is true, the game is still in progress. If the value is false, the game has either been won or lost and is no longer in progress.

      • minesLeft

        private int minesLeft
        The number of mines left to be marked by the player.

      • allCells

        private int allCells
        The total number of all cells .
